body: I actually think this is okay. In fact, after we were playing around with the app for a bit, I was starting to like this!
yes! this would be cool!
are there specific ones we're worried about? how about ipad?

I agree that you get used to it and it sounds kinda neat! But I instantly recognize this sound as meaning that the waveform is corrupted. It's a very unnatural sound. Oh but this makes me think, we could definitely have different instruments that intentionally have a strong attack like this built into the ADSR. I just made #8 to track that haha.

I already know for a fact that it's screwy on a 6 Plus because we're size based on the screen height, which stretches some images and not the others. I think the right solution is to use container nodes to handle the tap target and center the images within them.

The accidental buttons are different than the note buttons lol and the logo is definitely not where we want it!
![simulator screen shot sep 16 2015 1 32 19 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4397642/9897117/c6f3aa54-5c12-11e5-8d78-9af2baa70c63.png)
Oh, but we're not supporting iPad so we don't have to worry about that one, just the various iPhone sizes.

Should this be shown on first launch only? Or something that you can come back to whenever you want?

I lean towards first launch because the app is simple enough that once you play around with it a bit, you'll remember everything I think?
@dannysepler I'm having doubts about this now, this isn't how buttons normally behave; do you think I should just close this issue?
Closed via 24196f03428d6abc38919ab3b53f6fd51920c779.

Might as well just release automatically.
Although it's easy to add the functionality, making it feel natural will take more time.
Submitting!
Verified.

Closed via 0b1dc369962138f093e435fe7f6f09f344c3d050.
I should be able to fix this when I switch the underlying technology away from AudioKit.
AudioKit officially doesn't support tvOS yet. https://github.com/audiokit/AudioKit/issues/234
Should be an easy fix, might as well do it for v2.0.0.

Looks like tvOS only supports up to 2 bluetooth devices… using Bonjour over Wi-Fi might be the only option since there's no MultipeerConnectivity framework either?

https://forums.developer.apple.com/thread/17417
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/samplecode/WiTap/Introduction/Intro.html
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/Cocoa/Reference/Foundation/Classes/NSNetService_Class/History.html

https://forums.developer.apple.com/message/71922
https://forums.developer.apple.com/thread/17417

Closed via ab9b8643f6d6032442f51cc7412ef233ddaad1bb.
Now I'm not so sure. In a previous project I had the delay set at 0.05, and it's currently at 0.03 here. Making it too much smaller might make the ghost notes too noticeable again.
